summary: This is a determination notice from the Claims Administrator of the Epstein Survivors' Settlement Fund JPM, informing a claimant (Jane Doe 1) that their allocated settlement amount is $1,000,000. It also announces the launch of a U.S. Virgin Islands mental health fund for survivors.

persons.name: Simone Lelchuk
persons.context: Administers the Epstein Survivors' Settlement Fund JPM and the U.S. Virgin Islands Mental Health Fund for survivors. She signs the determination letter.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: The recipient of this settlement determination notice, identified as a Class Member of the Epstein DB Fund and the Epstein JPM Fund.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator whose actions led to the creation of the settlement funds and mental health fund for survivors.

connections.description: Lelchuk, as Claims Administrator, is notifying Jane Doe 1 of her settlement allocation from the Epstein JPM Fund.
Jane Doe 1 is identified as a survivor of Jeffrey Epstein, making her eligible for the settlement and mental health funds.

events.title: JPM Stipulation of Settlement Signed
events.description: The Stipulation of Settlement for the Epstein JPM Fund was dated, establishing the terms and evaluation guidelines for the settlement.

events.title: Mental Health Fund Launch
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands Mental Health Fund for survivors of Jeffrey Epstein officially launches, to be administered by Simone Lelchuk.

events.title: Settlement Determination Issued
events.description: Simone Lelchuk issues a determination notice to Jane Doe 1, allocating a $1,000,000 settlement from the Epstein JPM Fund.

keyFacts: A claimant identified as Jane Doe 1 was allocated a settlement of $1,000,000 from the Epstein Survivors' Settlement Fund JPM.
The settlement is governed by a Stipulation of Settlement dated June 22, 2023, and the allocated amount is final and non-appealable.
The U.S. Virgin Islands established a separate Mental Health Fund for survivors of Jeffrey Epstein, which launched on January 16, 2024.
The payment to the claimant is intended for damages related to physical injuries and emotional distress, and is structured to be potentially excludable from taxable income.
The document references an underlying legal case: Jane Doe 1 v. JP Morgan Chase Bank, N.A., Case No. 22-cv-10019 (JSR).
